body:
There's a test in Neomake (https://github.com/neomake/neomake/blob/5e140db568eb2f7b88e4110cd4b651562e8878ab/tests/compat.vader#L144-L172), which causes a SIGSEGV with https://github.com/neovim/neovim/commit/08ca5207cd284c8e5a1f1a47b98356415f4c1cf7:


comment_data.body: is this `--headless` mode? likely some initializations are missing when drawing the pum without any redraw first.
when `update_screen(0)`  in `ins_compl_show_pum` return FAIL then pum cannot really be displayed, in this case because startup sets `RedrawingDisabled`. I will try to construct a minimal reproduce.

@bfredl 
Just in case you are awaiting an answer still, although I've figured/thought you've found out based on the second comment:

> is this `--headless` mode?

Yes, since it works better with/for the tests.

(FWIW it is still an issue on master, would be glad to test anything)
`nvim --clean -E -s --cmd 'exe "norm! i\<C-X>\<C-V>"' --cmd 'q!'` seems to reproduce the crash.

labels.description: issue reporting a crash or segfault
labels.name: bug-crash

title: Segmentation fault in pum_display (regression in master)
